programme.desc: Charlotte Murray Pace, an LSU graduate, is found dead in her home on May 31, 2002, and the brutality of the crime scene reminds police of the unsolved case of Gina Wilson Green.

programme.title: Butchers of the Bayou
programme.desc: The investigation focuses on a white man with a white pickup truck; in March 1994, Ann Bryan is found murdered in her home at the St. James Place retirement community; despite attempts to catch her killer, the case goes cold.

programme.title: Butchers of the Bayou
programme.desc: After Derrick Todd Lee is arrested, police are able to connect him to other cold cases; at the time, Baton Rouge, La., had approximately 60 unsolved cases of missing or murdered women in the area from the previous 10 years.

programme.title: This Week With George Stephanopoulos
programme.desc: Former Clinton White House staffer and current co-anchor of ABC's weekday morning news show "Good Morning America," George Stephanopoulos and co-anchors Martha Raddatz and Jonathan Karl offer a look at current events with a focus on the politics of the day. Each week's show includes interviews with top newsmakers (including some of the nation's top political leaders) as well as a roundtable discussion, usually featuring journalists from ABC and other news organizations, of the week's happenings. Since 2008, the program has broadcast from a studio at the Newseum in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: NFL Daily
programme.desc: Gregg Rosenthal and a rotating crew of elite NFL Media co-hosts, including Patrick Claybon, Colleen Wolfe, Steve Wyche, Nick Shook and Jourdan Rodrigue of The Athletic get viewers caught up daily on all the NFL news and analysis.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the Week 3, 2018 matchup between the New York Jets and the Cleveland Browns, the No. 1 overall pick replaced injured starter Tyrod Taylor and sparked the Browns, who got two 1-yard touchdown runs from Carlos Hyde and beat the New York Jets 21-17 on Thursday night for their first win since Dec. 24, 2016.

programme.title: Episode 3
programme.desc: An amateur takes on the biggest names in poker in a high stakes cash game in Las Vegas. This week, a new rivalry emerges, as Lex Veldhuis and Alan Keating compete for a pot worth more than a quarter of a million dollars.

programme.title: Episode 4
programme.desc: The high stakes cash game continues in Las Vegas, with more than a million dollars now on the table. Entrepreneur Alan Keating continues to drive the action, determined to play every single hand, and make big moves.

programme.title: Episode 5
programme.desc: It's the final session of this high stakes game in Vegas, and the last chance for the amateur ‘Loose Cannon’ to make a profit. Meanwhile, Hollywood actors Arden Cho and Jennifer Tilly play a hand worth $400,000.

programme.title: Episode 6
programme.desc: A fresh cast of characters take their seats in Las Vegas for a high stakes cash game, including poker pros Phil Laak and Maria Ho, actor-writer-comedian Michael Ian Black, and an amateur player – a new ‘Loose Cannon’ – looking to make more than just memories.

programme.title: Episode 3
programme.desc: An amateur takes on the biggest names in poker in a high stakes cash game in Las Vegas. This week, a new rivalry emerges, as Lex Veldhuis and Alan Keating compete for a pot worth more than a quarter of a million dollars.

programme.title: Episode 4
programme.desc: The high stakes cash game continues in Las Vegas, with more than a million dollars now on the table. Entrepreneur Alan Keating continues to drive the action, determined to play every single hand, and make big moves.

programme.title: Episode 5
programme.desc: It's the final session of this high stakes game in Vegas, and the last chance for the amateur ‘Loose Cannon’ to make a profit. Meanwhile, Hollywood actors Arden Cho and Jennifer Tilly play a hand worth $400,000.

programme.title: Episode 6
programme.desc: A fresh cast of characters take their seats in Las Vegas for a high stakes cash game, including poker pros Phil Laak and Maria Ho, actor-writer-comedian Michael Ian Black, and an amateur player – a new ‘Loose Cannon’ – looking to make more than just memories.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Standing in the way of the Yankees' third-straight World Series championship are their crosstown rivals, the Mets - back in the Fall Classic for the first time since they won it all in 1986.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 2001 matchup between the D-backs and the Yankees. New York took a 3-2 series lead but strong pitching and a late-inning comeback in Game 7 led Arizona to knock off the defending champs securing the World Series title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first-ever World Series matchup between two Wild Card teams lived up to the "wild" name, as the Angels survived Barry Bonds and a 3-2 series deficit to take home their first World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: "The Marlins stun the Yankees and win their second World Series title, four games to two.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Host Michelle Beadle tours PETCO Park, built in the heart of downtown San Diego and explores the area's storied baseball history.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Rogers Centre in Downtown Toronto, Canada. The stadium opened in 1989 and was the first sports venue with a fully retractable roof.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The stadium has been home to the Phillies since 2004.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Comerica Park in Detroit, Michigan. The Tigers' home since 2000 is known for its large dimensions and scoreboard.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys attempt to check off the final five states Freiburger needs to hit all 50 by taking their junkyard T-37 across New England; the T-37 hits the road, and the road hits back before the guys leave their mark in New York City.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich troubleshoot transmission issues and more in the 1969 Chevy Impala that's powered by a supercharged 498ci big-block V8, then take it back to the track to see if they can finally get their 10-second time slip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Finnegan, Newbern and Cotten do some wheelie R&D to find out what it takes to put a 1978 GMC Class C motorhome's tires in the air; with the help of pro wheelstander Mike Mantel, the guys take on the challenge of making dreams become reality.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Recently, while the guys were thrashing the Crusher Impala, Freiburger spotted a 440-swapped '68 Dart he couldn't pass up. Now, the guys pick up the Dart and take it home to give it an impressive engine bay makeover and horsepower-adding tune-up.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: One crushed project means new parts for another; the guys take on a NASCAR stock car piloted by Corey LaJoie around Atlanta Motor Speedway by recycling the supercharger from their wrecked T-Bird and slapping it on a 1978 Ford Fairmont.

programme.title: Roadkill

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

After both his missions stall, Brittles attempts a face-to-face meeting with an important Native American chief in order to stave off an impending war.

programme.title: The Hanged Man
programme.desc: Miraculously still alive after his hanging, a gunfighter in need of redemption defends a beautiful young widow's farm from a vicious land grabber.

programme.title: Kit Carson
programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. Concerned by the dangers of Indian attacks, Carson hesitates, but then agrees despite the wagon train having already arranged for protection from a cavalry unit led by Capt. John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

programme.title: Hardcase
programme.desc: A soldier of fortune (Clint Walker) learns his wife (Stefanie Powers) sold the ranch and ran off with a Mexican revolutionary.

programme.title: Cahill U.S. Marshal
programme.desc: A rugged U.S. marshal faces a difficult task when he discovers that his two neglected sons are involved in the bank robbery he is investigating.

programme.title: Riders of the Range
programme.desc: A cowboy (Tim Holt) and his Irish-Mexican sidekick (Richard Martin) help a woman (Jacqueline Wells) whose brother is in debt.

programme.title: Gold of the Seven Saints
programme.desc: After discovering a fortune in gold nuggets, Shaun Garrett (Roger Moore) and his partner, Jim Rainbolt (Clint Walker), make their way toward the town of Seven Saints to redeem it for cash. Word of their find reaches bandit McCracken (Gene Evans), who comes after them. The men hide their treasure and fend off McCracken with the help of Doc Gates (Chill Wills), before escaping to recover at the ranch of Rainbolt's friend, Amos Gondora (Robert Middleton), waiting until they can retrieve the gold.

programme.title: Yellowstone Kelly
programme.desc: Union soldier Maj. Towns (Rhodes Reason) asks fur trapper and Indian scout Luther "Yellowstone" Kelly (Clint Walker) to scout for the Army in Sioux territory. Kelly ventures into the area, only to be taken prisoner by the Sioux. Since Kelly saved the life of Chief Gall (John Russell) years before, the chief promises to free him if Kelly treats wounded Arapaho maiden Wahleeah (Andra Martin). Soon Kelly and the recovered Wahleeah are caught between Towns' soldiers and the vengeful Sioux.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Soon after the end of the Civil War, Blayde Hollister (Gary Cooper), a former Confederate officer, is a fugitive from the law. He fakes his own death in order to avoid arrest and to lull his enemies into a false sense of security. It turns out Hollister is gunning for the brothers who murdered his family during the war. Joining up with the newly arrived Marshal Martin Weatherby (Leif Erickson), Hollister heads for Dallas, where his targets are terrorizing the population with a crime spree.

programme.title: Springfield Rifle
programme.desc: During the Civil War, Union forces stationed in Colorado are hampered by raiders who have been stealing their horses as they travel through the mountains. When several commanding officers begin to suspect a traitor is revealing troop movements, Maj. Lex Kearny (Gary Cooper) goes undercover to investigate. However, the assignment strains Kearny's relationship with his wife, Erin (Phyllis Thaxter), after he chooses to continue the operation instead of searching for their runaway son.

programme.title: The Hanging Tree
programme.desc: Joseph "Doc" Frail (Gary Cooper) is a doctor with a past he's trying to outrun. While in Montana, he comes across a mining camp with a hanging tree and rescues a man named Rune (Ben Piazza) from the noose. With Rune as his servant, Frail decides to settle down, and he takes over as town doctor. He meets Elizabeth (Maria Schell), who is suffering from shock, and the two soon fall in love. But when Elizabeth is attacked, Frail's attempt to help her lands them both in trouble.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Man Class
programme.desc: In his first one-hour comedy special, the former MADtv comic gives his unique take on how to be a real man in our ever-changing modern society.

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Never Grow Up
programme.desc: The comedian examines the way our modern culture works, and wonders why we feel the need to view each other in such a narrow box.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Godfrey: Regular Black
programme.desc: The hilarious, fearless comic discusses college, public transportation, and more in this comedy special performed in his hometown of Chicago.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where childhood sweethearts Tony and Lisa hope their guests will fall head over heels for their family friendly B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Shirley B&B in Bournemouth, where Jorge Mesquita hopes to impress his guests with his all-round cleanliness and the power of his showers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Kicking off the competition in Anglesey are newbie owners Neil and Lavinia Walker who run Castellor B&B, where it's all about going the extra mile. But the in-room extras fail to impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Marlow Lodge in Blackpool, where owner Deano Whiting prides himself on delivering the fun factor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host this week is manager James Hall and owner's son Adam Neale of The Black Swan in Horsham St Faith, a luxury roomed establishment with onsite restaurant and pub.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Bleak House in Broadstairs, where sisters Nina and Nicola Hilton have `Great Expectations' of success and the guests are blown away by a Dickens discovery.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Torquay and owners Mark and Jo Warden hope their four-star establishment, The Cimon, has what it takes to win.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cardinal's Hat in Worcester where owner Nigel Smith, who has more than 30 years of experience in hospitality, likes the finer things in life.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to Cledan Valley in Mid Wales, where husband and wife duo Russ and Karen Colman hope their glamping site will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Springfield House in Instow, Devon, where Lucinda Renshaw, who is joined in the competition by friend Diane Passmore, transformed this home in to a B&B eight years ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Huddersfield, where John Whitworth hopes the unique style of The Edge Accommodation has enough personality to win over his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Darwin Lake Holiday Village in Matlock, managed by best friends Sally McAnulty and Teresa Shirley, who take pride in their exclusive village feel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group head to Sands Resort Hotel and Spa in Newquay, where father-and-son team Nicholas and Tom Malcolm pride themselves on the vast facilities they have on offer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Oak Tree Lane Yurt Site in Bratton Clovelly, Devon, where owner Phil Gilbert is taking things back to basics. On arrival, the guests are wowed by the Mongolian yurts.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Church Street Cobbles in Macclesfield, where foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened a B&B above a barber shop.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock and roll venue The Vic Bikers pub in Leicestershire where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On day three, Steve and Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests at The Cranberries Hideaway in Devon.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi hope to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Helmsley North Yorkshire at Laskill Country House, where straight-talking farmer's daughter Mandy Sowray and friend Anny Harrison run a tight ship.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Swan Hotel in Telford owned by Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy. They are hoping straightforward value for money will win them the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers head to Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire where Colin Warburg, along with student son Ben, hope their 81 room country pile will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the competition this week is to The Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House in Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave and Sanchia aim to win over their guests with their 300-year-old cottage turned guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes they'll leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark Toole and Natalie Allcock look to wow their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Truro, Cornwall, at Causilgey Manor, where former art dealers Robin and Brenda Spence want to treat their guests to a stay in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where hosts Leoni Wilton and Tish Broughton want to swathe their guests in the sweet stuff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to The Buckle Seaford, in East Sussex, where B&B newbies Julie and Jason Martin have set sail for seaside luxe. Can they chart a course for victory?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Ayr, Scotland, at Blackburn Villa where Karen runs a home from home B&B helped by daughter Jade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gretna Green, Scotland, where Kieran and fiancée Paula of The Hazeldene are proud of the marital importance of their hotel, but suspect game playing by their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&B'ers head to Pembrokeshire, Wales, and 32 Townhouse, where Dominic Swingler and his mum Eileen hope their style and décor wows their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Greylands Guest House, in Powys Wales, where Lynda Fry and Larnie Carter have set high standards for themselves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Norfolk at The Old Ram Coaching Inn, five-star trained Victoria MacDonald welcomes the guests. But there's a dusty towel rail and suspicious brown smudge in the toilet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price, but Victoria is looking for payback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Beach Lodge Hotel in Mablethorpe, hosts Michele and Cheryl aim to offer the perfect beachside break. The rooms seem to hit the spot at first, but then there's a hair-raising incident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Farmer's Arms, Taunton, where Alan and Alison hope their palatial rooms will win them the competition, but Michele and Cheryl are unimpressed by the cleanliness.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Waverley Hotel in Callander, Scotland, owned by husband and wife Gordon and Jan Halladay, who are are shocked and surprised at some of the scores.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Greenview Guesthouse in Cumbria, owned by Tanya Briggs, with help from best friend Vicky Hope. There's some fishy business and one guest goes green at the gills.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the lavish Hotel Sheraton in Blackpool, run by mum and son Liz and Ollie Brown, and where Rory discovers his own personal illuminations in the bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Chapter Two Accommodation in Malton, where Katharine and Rory offer proper Yorkshire hospitality and a belly busting offering at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in north Norfolk at The Hero, run by best mates Harry and Rowan, who both quit university to follow their dream of becoming hospitality entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cleasewood Guest House in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, a labour of love for rookie B&B owners Debbie and Arthur Callaghan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the B&Bers head to Peel Hey on the Wirral, where boss Helen Holmes and assistant Suzanne hope their seven decades of experience will give them the edge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Four Saints Brig Y Don in Llandudno, where Egyptian-born owner Shoukry, with best friend Waguih, believes his `international standard' hotel will scoop him the prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first day of this competition is at the Blackthorn Farm B&B on Anglesey, Wales, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to be crowned best value B&B of the week. On arrival, Dan and Rachel Lonergan take in the view, and Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor are feeling the vibes for their morning meditation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Graham and Barbara Yellow pride themselves on offering basic facilities for great value for money at the White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire. Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch find some hairs out of place in their room, while spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from being in room number four. Over dinner, Graham and Barbara relax into their roles, leaving Rachel Lonergan feeling guilty about having labelled them as game players.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor have an alternative approach to their business at The Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset. Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch think it will be a wigwam, while Rachel and Dan Lonergan are expecting a commune.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Inn, B&B newcomers Rachel and Dan Lonergan want to offer a luxury, boutique experience for their guests. After getting negative feedback on the last visit, Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor go on the offensive.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Features the Union Inn in Cowes, the Shoreside Inn in Shanklin, Raj's Kirribilli Guesthouse in Newquay, and the Elysian Fields B&B in Helston.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Oak Tree Cottage in Burley, where owner Jacqui Castle is the first to host.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the village of Worstead in Norfolk where Dennis Gilligan runs The White Lady, which he claims has a ghostly extra guest.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Cranleigh House B&B in Coombe Martin, Devon, former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those into yoga and spiritual enlightenment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Qualifier sees the return of an old favourite, the ‘Big Red Balls’.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, the North of the country takes on the South in a battle to win the coveted trophy.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The game is divided into two teams, one with UK contestants and the other with people from all over the world.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain and Dizzy Dummies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier and The Sweeper.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, the North of the country takes on the South in a battle to win the coveted trophy.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This week they have added a new obstacle called 'The Dreadmill'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ten celebrities from the world of sport and television take on one of the most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: During this episode contestants face new challenges on 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Can magician Darren run the travellator and cross the Big Red Balls?

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Awards. This programme presented by Richard Hammond encompasses all of the best action of the series.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E02 - Indian

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E03 - Chinese

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E02 - Episode 2

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E03 - Episode 3

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E04 - British

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E05 - Thai

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E05 - Episode 5

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E06 - Episode 6

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon last left Laurence knowing that he had simplified his menu to have clean, simple, honest, traditional food using local produce. Surely this was enough to bring back the locals and win back the faith of the ex-pats.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: With landlord Brian's continual stress and interference in the kitchen, which Gordon believed was one of the main reasons for the inefficiencies of The Fenwick Arms, and now the added pressure of new competition, it's no wonder the pub is in trouble. Gordon's not going to like what's happened in his absence.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of Scotland's top chefs, Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee, and Graham Campbell - attempt to impress this week's veteran judge. Having missed out last year, returning finalist Jak is determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell fight it out for the fish course. Graham is in a confident mood but returning finalist Jak and self-taught Jimmy are pushing him hard. Will the pressure prove too much for ambitious Graham?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell are battling to plate up a perfect main course for this week's veteran chef. Self-taught Jimmy is honouring his mum with his rendition of her Chinese beef stew.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today it's the Scottish chefs' last chance to impress, with the dessert course. Only two can cook for the judges tomorrow, and with one chef in the lead after a triumphant main, the pressures on for the other two to plate up perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scottish chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, who will help decide which chef will go forward to the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the south west's finest chefs - Jude Kereama, Josh Eggleton and Dominic Chapman - attempt to impress a veteran judge with their starters. As the only newcomer in the kitchen, Jude is determined to plate up a winning dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three south west chefs fight it out for the fish course. Despite schoolboy errors during the starter, experienced Dominic is determined to get a high score on the course. But will newcomer Jude, a seafood master, overcome his nerves to plate up?.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The south-west chefs have one last chance to impress as they face the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges; with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining south-west judges must cook their entire menus again for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. Joining the judges is Radhika Bynon, a member of the Forest Gate Women's Institute, a modern urban group of women.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael are challenged to plate up perfect starter courses for this week's veteran judge. It's the first time in the Great British Menu kitchen for all three chefs, so who will triumph and who will fall?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael fight it out for the fish course. Experimental chef Stephen is determined to prove himself with a fish course honouring the WI's tradition of preserving, but he's up against stiff competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course with the Welsh chefs going head to head. With all three chefs paying homage to Welsh lamb; Adam with a refined dish, Phil with a dish dedicated to his Mum and Stephen with a lamb dish celebrating the WI.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the tricky dessert course and the last chance for the Welsh chefs to secure their place in tomorrow's regional final. With everything to play for, the pressure is fierce. Only two can make it through, and one will leave the competition for good.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two remaining Welsh chefs cook their four courses again for the judges and Rosemary Bishton. One chef will be chosen to represent Wales in the National Finals taking them a step closer to cooking at the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of Northern Ireland's top chefs - Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold - go head to head with their starter courses to impress this week's veteran judge. Former champion Chris is back for glory and determined to reach the banquet, but he's up against two newcomers with their sights firmly set on victory.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold are cooking their fish courses. Ambitious Ben is determined to steal Chris's regional crown, but under fierce scrutiny from this week's formidable veteran, will the pressure to deliver spell melt down?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of Northern Ireland's finest chefs - Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold. Ambitious Ben is out to prove himself with a perfect lamb main course.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the Northern Irish chefs are all striving for one of the two spots in the Regional Final. The pressure is intense, and in the end one chef must leave the competition empty handed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North Irish chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by a guest judge - award winning food writer Felicity Cloake.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen are going head to head this week for a chance to represent the North East region in the National Finals. Today it's a battle for starter course, and the first chance to impress their formidable veteran chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fight for the fish course, as three of the North East's finest chefs - Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen - are out to impress. After his risky starter caused a stir yesterday Michael is planning another controversial dish in honour of the WI's support of women's rights.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the North East's most dynamic chefs - Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen - go head to head cooking their main courses. Michelin-starred Tim is super keen to bag the first ten of the week, but Michael and Mini are hot on his heels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the North East chefs' last chance to impress with the dessert course. It's been a week of highs and lows, modern audacious dishes and classic masterpieces but with only two places up for grabs cooking for the judges, at the end of today who will leave the competition empty handed?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by a guest judge - WI president Kirsty Bowen from Sheffield - who will help decide which chef will go through to represent the North East in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Representing the North West are Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and returning contender Mark Ellis. Today's the starter course, and after failing to cook for the judges last year Mark's out to redeem himself but he faces stiff competition in executive chef Eve and young gun Matt.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course, as three of the North West's finest chefs - Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and Mark Ellis - go head to head. Eve and Matt are hoping their classic approach to cooking fish will win the day whilst Mark is going all out with fishy take on a traditional dessert recipe.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle for the main course for the three North West chefs - Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and Mark Ellis. Mark remains determined and focused on his battle to get to judges chamber this year, but as the pressure to plate up perfection reaches fever pitch, will all three chefs get a dish to the pass?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the North West chefs' last chance to impress, with the dessert course. Only two can cook for the judges tomorrow. It's the end of the road for one chef, but who will it be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North West chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by award winning food writer Sabrina Ghayour and together they'll decide which chef will go on to represent the North West in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course for three of London and the South East's hottest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt Gillan is determined to make it to this year's banquet, but he faces fierce competition in the two newcomers.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund - go head to head with their fish courses. Lee is hoping his modern plate of mackerel and passion fruit will outclass Matt and Mark's more traditionally inspired salmon dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the Central Region's finest chefs - Pip Lacey, Richard Bainbridge and Jason Hodnett - attempt to impress this week's veteran judge with their starters. programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Central Region chefs to impress, with the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges so with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central Region chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day, the half-way point in Finals Week, and those chefs who have yet to get a dish on the shortlist are feeling the heat. With only dishes judged to be perfect in with a chance at reaching the WI banquet, the standards are higher than ever before.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Tracey and Rob's Newport home has it all: dangerous sloped banks, a multi-level space full of wild weeds, overgrown hedges and too many trees. For those brave enough to make it to the top, however, the garden offers a magnificent view.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell find the X—but they're pretty sure they'll have competition come sunrise. And if you "ain't first, you're last." They set up camp, sleep at the ramp, and are waiting at first light, when the feet-down mallards come pouring in.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Sweepstakes winners Jackson and Carson Hirschler make their first trip to Arkansas to hunt with Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell at Ole South Outfitters. Ole South's Blake Burrus rolls out the red carpet to the young hunters, providing an experience of a lifetime.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: In this week's episode, Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell start their 2019 duck vacation on public land. After a couple days tracking birds, they pin-point a feeding area and team up with a couple locals to get after 'em. It's a public-land cornfield -- a field of dreams -- but they have a hard decision to make.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With duck seasons coming to a close across the country, Realtree's crews heads to East Central Louisiana to hunt ducks at Honey Brake Lodge. There's still plenty of ducks in the area after the arctic cold snap the affected the country, and it shows!!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell take a duck vacation with Mark Pine at Eagle Lakes Ranch in Washington. This place is mallard duck heaven and it holds one of the nation's largest populations of mallards. Needless to say, these call-runnin', gun-totin', duck-shootin' fellas from the South have fun on their northern adventure.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Drake Waterfowl's Jimbo Ronquest joins the crew in Louisana for the last day of the Realtree Max-7 pro-staff hunt. It is a morning to remember as the ducks fall into the decoys and the guys limit out before 8:00 a.m. on the Mississippi flyway.
Kris Seymour and family target a couple big Kansas whitetails!

Tarif Alkhatibs is new to Team200, but no stranger to killing someof the biggest free range whitetails in his home state of Texas –including the state record typical!

Team200 takes an in depth look at bowhunting’s million dollar question. How do you predict what a mature buck is going to do before he actually does it? Get the answer and see some world class animals harvested on the Red Moon.

programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join seasoned anglers Danny Allen and Greg Devault as they embark on an exhilarating fishing expedition along the serene waters of the Econfina River and the breathtaking Gulf Coast. In this thrilling TV show, watch as Danny and Greg tackle the challenges of reeling in trophy fish while exploring the diverse ecosystems and hidden gems of these picturesque locales. With expert tips, breathtaking scenery, and unforgettable moments, this fishing adventure promises excitement and inspiration for anglers of all levels. Tune in to witness the excitement unfold on the waters of the Econfina River and the Gulf Coast with Danny Allen and Greg Devault!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell head to Louisiana AKA "The Sportsman's Paradise" to kick off Season 4 of "Dr. Duck presented by Federal's Black Cloud." They'll be hanging with good friend Gem Ceasar at Cypress Cove Landing for a full Cajun experience.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys at Realtree get together to kick off the 2023-24 Federal Black Cloud waterfowl season. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and friends at Realtree put on an epic early season teal hunt in the Louisiana rice fields.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‪@ben_moon‬ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. That’s the ethos of Mañana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Mañana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew FINALLY make it to the Bahamas and the incredible Green Turtle Club for a week of fishing, diving, and exploring the Abaco Island chain. programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Mike heads to Table Rock Lake to meet up with Trenton and his family. Even battling the tough fishing conditions following a heavy front, there’s never a lack of family time, laughs or friendly competitions with the Southards.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: There are taxidermist and then there is marine reproduction artists. Mike Kirkhart is an amazing talent that reproduces marine life in such a way that it looks alive to his customers. He has won every award there is in this business and anglers seek his expertise in replicating their catches from Australia to the Middle East! Please enjoy this sit down conversation with the guy who is number one in fish taxidermy, the very talented Mr. Mike Kirkhart.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.desc: Florida businesses like Chris’ rely on water quality and another water crisis would be detrimental.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks gets a chance to punch a long awaited Wisconsin sturgeon tag and then chats with the local DNR to learn about sturgeon spawning season.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We return to the Ellie B and head a hundred miles offshore to repeat last year’s epic tuna bite. But someone must have brought a banana on board because the plan suddenly turned into an unexpected adventure.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys at Realtree get together to kick off the 2023-24 Federal Black Cloud waterfowl season. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and friends at Realtree put on an epic early season teal hunt in the Louisiana rice fields.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‪@ben_moon‬ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. That’s the ethos of Mañana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Mañana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: 8 Seconds
programme.desc: Dreams and perseverance lead to an Oklahoma boy's meteoric rise as a champion bull rider in this film about the life of pro rodeo cowboy Lane Frost.

programme.title: True Stories
programme.desc: David Byrne whimsically pays homage to the mythical small Texas town of Virgil.

programme.title: Jackie Chan's First Strike
programme.desc: Caught between the CIA, the Mafia, and Russian intelligence, a keen yet bumbling cop finds himself at the center of a plot to steal a nuclear warhead.

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Six young urbanites with budding careers and restless hearts share their dreams, their music, and the common courtyard between their apartments.

programme.title: Elvis: That's The Way It Is (Special Edition)
programme.desc: This feature-length concert film crosses the footlights to reveal the King of Rock and Roll’s triumphant 1970 return to the stage in Las Vegas.

programme.title: ABBA The Movie
programme.desc: A young D.J. on his first assignment follows ABBA during a sold-out, screaming, wild tour across Australia.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: In this unofficial sequel to Purple Rain, the Kid and Morris are rival nightclub owners tangled in a power struggle over the Minneapolis music scene.

programme.title: Who's That Girl?
programme.desc: A woman sets off on a madcap quest to find the person guilty of the crime for which she served the time.

programme.title: Oh, God!
programme.desc: George Burns stars as God when He comes to Earth, business card in hand.

programme.title: Oh, God! Book II
programme.desc: God returns to Earth and recruits a student to help him devise an advertising campaign to spread his message.

programme.title: Oh, God! You Devil
programme.desc: A musician sells his soul to the Devil, as God and the Devil battle for the musician's soul.

programme.title: One Crazy Summer
programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Two sanitation workers and diehard wrestling fans watch their idol suffer a career-ending defeat and travel to Atlanta to mastermind his comeback.

programme.title: The Messengers
programme.desc: When the Solomons trade in the craziness of big-city life for the quiet of a North Dakota farm, little do they expect the nightmare that follows. Soon after arriving, teenage Jess (Kristen Stewart) and her younger brother see terrifying apparitions and endure attacks from a supernatural source. Jess must warn her disbelieving family before it is too late to save them.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: Three of the world’s best pilots are partnered with a high-tech pilotless warplane, but soon it becomes clear that the machine has a mind of its own.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: A sudden storm leaves a family shipwrecked on an uncharted island inhabited by other stranded settlers and a tribe of natives with strange powers.

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Dreaming of being a famous R&B guitarist, a young virtuoso seeks out a legendary musician and must convince him to teach him the ways of the blues.

programme.title: Double Platinum
programme.desc: Years after she abandoned her baby girl, a famous singer must face her now teenage daughter and repair their complicated relationship.

programme.title: No Small Affair
programme.desc: When Charles Cummings sees a down-on-her-luck rock singer, Laura Victor, through his camera lens, he immediately falls head over heels in love.

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: The Seventh Sign
programme.desc: A young woman discovers that she and her unborn child have been chosen to play a terrifying part in the chain of events destined to end the world.
